Detailed Description

An abstract string type that defines the specifications for Unicode strings.

Specific encodings are implemented as derived types of this class.

ChaosCore primarily uses UTF-8 encoded strings, for further documentation on using Unicode strings see the UTF8String documentation.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

chaos::uni::UString::UString ( const UString &  other)
protected

Copy constructor.

Calling this constructor from a derived class's initialiser lists will cause the m_data, m_data_length, and m_length attributes to be copied.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void chaos::uni::UString::assign_raw ( const char *  data,
size_t  length = UString::npos 
)
protectedvirtual

Assigns the internal raw array (m_data) of this string to be a be a copy of the provided data.

This operation will cause any existing data to be deleted, new memory allocated, and copied from the provided data.

Warning
This will not calculate the m_length attribute (the number of symbols in the string) since this function only deals with raw byte data and not specific encodings. The m_length attribute should be calculated by derived classes in their implementations of this function.
Parameters
dataData array to be copied to the m_data attribute of this string.
lengthThe length of the supplied data in bytes. If this is set to to chaos::uni::UString::npos, this function will calculate the input data length with the expectation that it is NULL terminated. However if the input data length is known it is recommended that it is supplied for performance purposes.
virtual void chaos::uni::UString::check_symbol_index ( size_t  index) const
protectedvirtual

Can be used to check whether a provided symbol index is out of bounds in regard to the symbol length of this string.

Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided index is out of bounds of the string symbol length.
virtual void chaos::uni::UString::check_byte_index ( size_t  index) const
protectedvirtual

Can be used to check whether a provided byte index is out of bounds in regard to the byte length of this string.

Exceptions
chaos::ex::IndexOutOfBoundsErrorIf the provided index is out of bounds of the string byte length.
